titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 1413: Ledger of Risaliti debtors and creditors

notesStmt.note: Forms part of: Gondi-Medici Business Records.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Ledger of debtors and creditors of Francesco di Stefano Risaliti for the years 1559-1566. Often includes the nature of a given credit or debt and its amount, as well as listing the names of the individuals that hold the debt or credit. Many transactions appear to be with employees who operate in the wool and textile industry (especially dyers and spinners), who are paid for their services; but transactions with various workers (farmers, carpenters, builders) are also present. Other transactions are related to debts and credits between Francesco di Stefano Risaliti and business counterparts and members of the Florentine aristocracy, the most important being Luca Salvucci; Jacopo Amatucci; Antonio Risaliti; and Filippo Salviati. Some of these transactions appear to be loans of money to finance the development of textile businesses. The back flyleaf is a vellum leaf from a mid-12th-century manuscript from Italy, and is written in a Gothic script. It contains a passage from a Latin commentary on Paul's Epistle to the Thessalonians, with the quotations from the epistle in red ink.

msItem.title: Ledger of Risaliti debtors and creditors

supportDesc.extent: 192 leaves : 334 x 226 mm. bound to 343 x 228 mm. +
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 192 + i (parchment); versos numbered [1], 2-116, [117-192], contemporary pagination in ink, modern pagination in pencil, upper left verso; rectos numbered [i], i-cxvi, [cxvii-cxci], contemporary pagination in ink, modern pagination in pencil, upper right recto (pages 117-192 blank). Each opening has a matched Arabic numeral on the left and a Roman numeral on the right.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 2 columns with vertical bounding lines in lead; the large column on the left with the name of the counterpart and a brief description of the transaction, and the smaller one on the right with the amount of the transaction.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a cursive script by multiple hands.

binding.p: Contemporary vellum, no. 257 on spine; the heading Libro di debitori e creditori, no. 68 and letter C with decorative penwork on upper cover; lower cover wraps around upper cover with leather strap; decorative leatherwork on spine.
